expected_chunk:
Djarum - Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

5.2 Data Storage
Extension database stores:

1)        client_id

2)        authorized_endpoints

3)        Timestamps (created_date, updated_date)

5.3 Daily Scheduler
Run every day at 00:00.

Responsibilities:

1)        Fetch client IDs from platform.

2)        Compare with extension DB records.

3)        If a client ID in the extension no longer exists in the platform:

        a)        Delete the record (stale cleanup).

Scheduler is idempotent.

5.4 API Access Validation
For every request made to a Djarum Custom API:

1)        Check required platform permissions

        a)        The client must have access to the mandatory platform OAuth endpoints.

                i)        The client ID must have permission to call: GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token.

        b)        If these prerequisites are missing → the custom API cannot be used, return 403 Forbidden.

2)        Check extension-level custom API permission

        a)        Verify whether the client is allowed to call the specific custom API.

        b)        If not allowed → return 403 Forbidden.

        c)        If allowed → continue processing the request as usual.

5.5 Role & Permission
1)        Introduce a new extension-level trustee:

        a)        Extension OAuth 2.0 Client

                i)        View

                ii)        Manage

2)        Prerequisite for this role:

        a)        User must have Admin Panel – Extension access.

3)        Only authorized users may view or edit this menu.

Functional Requirements

###

Requirement Document
Systems Requirements
Software

Integration Card - Klik BCA Bisnis
Pada bagian ini akan dijelaskan card integrasi untuk kerja sama CATAPA dengan Klik BCA Bisnis.

1)        Setiap tenant dapat mendaftarkan integrasi ke BCA lebih dari satu kali.

        a)        Setiap Corporate ID di BCA dapat memiliki lebih dari 1 User ID

        b)        Sistem dapat menerima aktivasi integrasi dari setiap tenant lebih dari satu kali dengan menggunakan User ID yang berbeda

2)        Setiap user di CATAPA hanya dapat memiliki satu integrasi yang aktif dengan BCA

        a)        Jika user sudah melakukan registrasi dan berstatus In Progress atau Active, maka sistem dapat membatasi user tersebut untuk melakukan aktivasi lagi dengan cara:

                i)        Tombol Activate tidak dapat diklik oleh user yang memiliki integrasi dengan status In Progress atau Active

3)        Jika minimal ada satu user yang melakukan registrasi (status Active), maka menu Salary Disbursement via KlikBCA Bisnis dapat dibuka oleh seluruh user yang eligible dari menu trustee

4)        Sistem dapat menyimpan UniqueID dari hasil registrasi dan ditempelkan pada setiap user di CATAPA

5)        Pemrosesan Salary Disbursement akan membutuhkan UniqueID dari hasil registrasi:

        a)        Jika username tersebut memiliki UniqueID, maka pemrosesan dapat dilakukan

        b)        Jika username tersebut belum memiliki UniqueID, maka pemrosesan tidak dapat dilakukan

6)        Sistem dapat menampilkan informasi berikut (support multilanguage):

        a)        Logo Klik BCA Bisnis

        b)        Title

        c)        Deskripsi Integrasi Klik BCA Bisnis

        d)        Syarat dan ketentuan integrasi Klik BCA Bisnis

        e)        Proses integrasi Klik BCA Bisnis

                i)        Registrasi

                        1)        Menampilkan informasi yang dibutuhkan untuk registrasi

                ii)        Persetujuan Registrasi

                        1)        Menampilkan informasi cara melakukan approval pada aplikasi KBB

                iii)        Aktif

###

Requirement Document
Systems Requirements
Software
Integration Card - Klik BCA Bisnis

i)        Jika berhasil, berikan notifikasi

                ii)        Jika gagal, berikan notifikasi dan alasan gagal/error message.

8)        Sistem dapat menampilkan tabel yang berisi data user yang sudah melakukan aktivasi (berstatus In Progress, Rejected atau Active)

        a)        Username CATAPA

        b)        User ID Klik BCA Bisnis – disensor dan hanya menampilkan 3 char terakhir

        c)        Corporate ID Klik BCA Bisnis – disensor dan hanya menampilkan 3 char terakhir

        d)        Request Date (DD MMM YYYY HH:MM:SS) – sesuai dengan waktu submit formulir

                i)        Diisi jika status = In Progress, Rejected, Active

        e)        Active Date (DD MMM YYYY HH:MM:SS) – sesuai dengan selesainya seluruh proses aktivasi

                i)        Isi Active Date = “-” jika card masih berstatus Inactive

        f)        Detail Status

9)        Sistem dapat menampilkan Business Type yang terakhir disimpan oleh user yang melakukan registrasi (latest data)

10)        Card Status (status yang ditampilkan untuk satu card secara umum):

        a)        Jika belum ada registrasi yang memiliki status Rejected, In Progress dan Active → Inactive

        b)        Jika minimal terdapat 1 registrasi yang memiliki status in Progress tapi tidak ada status Active → In Progress

        c)        Jika minimal terdapat 1 registrasi yang memiliki status Active → Active

11)        Detail Status (status yang ditampilkan untuk setiap registrasi dalam tabel):

        a)        Jika registrasi berhasil dilakukan

                i)        Tambahkan data user ke dalam tabel data integration dengan status: In Progress

        b)        Jika registrasi gagal dilakukan:

                i)        Data user tidak dimasukkan ke tabel data integration

        c)        Jika registrasi berhasil dilakukan (saat mengirim payload), tapi karena satu dan lain hal integrasi tidak berhasil dilakukan: Failed

###

Requirement Document
Systems Requirements
Software
Salary Disbursement Via KlikBCA Bisnis

a)        Pada Salary Disbursement

                                        i)        Nilai Amount disesuaikan dengan nilai yang di proses ulang di Salary Payment

                                        ii)        Nilai Total Employee(s) disesuaikan dengan nilai yang di proses ulang di Salary Payment

                                b)        Pada Salary Disbursement Details

                                        i)        Total THP untuk setiap karyawan diupdate sesuai dengan proses ulang Salary Payment

                                        ii)        Jika sebelumnya data karyawan ada di Unprocessable karena Nilai THP 0, kemudian Nilai THP diupdate kembali (tidak 0) maka data dipindahkan ke Unprocessed.

12)        Process

        a)        Proses transfer dapat ditrigger dengan cara:

                i)        Klik button Process pada halaman Salary Disbursement

                ii)        Klik button Process All Data/Process Selected Data pada Salary Disbursement Details tab Unprocessed

        b)        Jika button Process diklik, sistem dapat menampilkan popup formulir:

                i)        Remarks – freetext

                ii)        Effective Time – number

        c)        Sebelum popup formulir dimunculkan, lakukan validasi:

                i)        Pastikan terdapat minimal 1 data yang ada pada bagian Unprocessed dan bisa diproses

                ii)        Jika tidak, tampilkan popup tidak bisa diproses

        d)        Jika formulir sudah diisi dan button Process diklik, maka:

                i)        Sistem akan membuat file dengan format yang sesuai dengan dokumentasi berikut [TecDoc MP PPJ 1.1.0.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qoIlf-IHcqlpXDgxbV7ctGAbOgYXkulL/view)

                ii)        Sistem akan mengirimkan file tersebut ke Klik BCA Bisnis sesuai dengan dokumentasi [Technical Documentation Bulk API v1.1.pdf](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1O3wOqk1me892tDeVqXUGHh3IxGNefBML/view?usp=sharing)

                iii)        Pastikan setiap trigger Process memiliki File ID dan Transaction ID yang berbeda

        e)        Sistem dapat menampilkan detail proses pada View Statistic Details

        f)        Jika proses transfer selesai

                i)        Pindahkan data dari Unprocessed ke Processed

###

CATAPA Automation
Solution
Phase 1

1)        Automation Triggers

Something that kicks off the activation of an automation. Triggers are predefined by CATAPA.

2)        Automation

Action(s) that will be executed after a trigger happens. Actions are consists of:

        a)        Variable

Defining any variable(s) that can be used for eligibility script and/or execution script.

        b)        Eligibility Script

Works as a filter to populate desired items that need to be executed.

        c)        Execution Script

Action that will be executed for every populated item.

question: Bagaimana ketentuan teknis dan batasan sistem CATAPA dalam mengelola data master organisasi, keamanan akun administrator, serta prosedur unggah massal dokumen di repositori karyawan?
expected_response: Sistem CATAPA beralih dari input manual kode organisasi/jabatan yang tidak efisien menuju fleksibilitas seperti kolom username yang menjadi opsional dan penambahan pusat biaya (cost center) untuk penyewa non-OM. Terkait validitas data, sistem kini mengizinkan perubahan data tanggal lampau (backdated) tanpa batasan tingkat sistem. Untuk keamanan, sistem melakukan blokir keras terhadap pemberhentian karyawan yang terhubung dengan akun "admin" guna mencegah hilangnya akses administrator. Dalam pengelolaan dokumen, fitur repositori menyediakan kategori tetap seperti "Warnings and Disciplinary" dan "Employment Contracts". Batasan teknis unggah massal adalah file ZIP maksimal 500 MB dan berisi paling banyak 1.000 file. Nama file dibatasi maksimal 255 karakter. Alur kerjanya dimulai dari pengunduhan template Excel hingga unggah ZIP, di mana jika terjadi kesalahan, sistem akan mengembalikan file "Failed_Results.xlsx" dan ZIP berisi data yang gagal saja untuk diperbaiki.
expected_chunk_automated:
Policy Automatic Code Position and Organization Generation

Background
In the CATAPA system, users are currently required to manually input the codes for setting up Organization and Position. This manual process can lead to inconsistencies, errors, and inefficiencies, especially as the organization grows and the number of entries increases.

Below is the mapping of tenants with similar customer requests:

###

Employee Registration Enhancement

Problem Statement
The current employee registration system mandates username creation even for employees who will never access CATAPA, while also preventing non-OM tenants from assigning cost centers during initial registration. This results in unnecessary data collection, incomplete employee profiles at registration, and additional administrative steps that delay accurate financial reporting.

Objective and Goals
1)	Transform the username field from mandatory to optional in employee registration to accommodate employees who don't require system access

2)	Add cost center field in employee registration form to enable complete financial data capture during initial employee creation

Assumptions
-

Current Implementation
Currently, the employee registration form:

--	Username: Mandatory field for all employees

--	User Email: Optional because not all user will have email address

--	Cost Center: Not available in registration form for OM OFF tenant; must be added through employment data update

--	Implementation spans across web application, massive update functionality, and API endpoints

Competitive Analysis

###

Employee Registration Enhancement
Solution

Phase 2
1)	Change default Value "Create Username?" = "Yes" in Employee Registration Form

2)	Release date: 3 October 2025

Mock Ups
Mockup: [https://www.figma.com/design/QLfQJ4RGZRX9JhJwjlroYN/Apps---Employee-Details?node-id=6671-8431&t=C9NNmTeTgaMJFfwn-0](https://www.figma.com/design/QLfQJ4RGZRX9JhJwjlroYN/Apps---Employee-Details?node-id=6671-8431&t=C9NNmTeTgaMJFfwn-0)

Employee Migration:
[Massive Update Employee - Master Sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dYNPGZ4jtLKjgAA710aSGGXImDAenvvVtGaqrx8T2BI/edit?gid=928084015#gid=928084015)

Change Highlight:

1)	There are two templates, one for when the Organization Management setting is ON and one for when it's OFF
[image_450068ea4b2455b5]
Employee Migration: OM OFF template
Employee Migration (OM): OM ON template

###

Backdated Data Changes in Employment Data

Background
See base PRD: [PRD202504W2 - Backdated Data Changes for Payroll Related Data](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VFW_5R-3vbWOah9tnIts9wk2bk_itneACpiaz1k3Ifs/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.pxx3fq71xird) and [[PRD] Migration Tools Transactional Data](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GfnelBoGtrgc3MEIZ5HStOidEkzuoCE3LD7qhsojpzs/edit?gid=1712256141#gid=1712256141)

Currently, CATAPA’s employment data update mechanism works much like a stack:

--	A new record can only be created after the previous record.

--	Past employment data cannot be edited once saved.

Additionally, there is an increasing urgency for a migration tool that supports backdated data. Since migration runs in batches based on the “changed on” date, the creation of backdated entries is inevitable.

Problem Statement
See base PRD: [PRD202504W2 - Backdated Data Changes for Payroll Related Data](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1VFW_5R-3vbWOah9tnIts9wk2bk_itneACpiaz1k3Ifs/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.pxx3fq71xird) and [[PRD] Migration Tools Transactional Data](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GfnelBoGtrgc3MEIZ5HStOidEkzuoCE3LD7qhsojpzs/edit?gid=1712256141#gid=1712256141)

Objective
1)	Assess the side effects of the Effective-Date Monotonicity Removal on Employment Data, especially on the Time Management Module and the Benefit Management Module

2)	Remove Effective-Date Monotonicity on Employment Data: Users will be allowed to enter or update records using any effective date, including ones that are the same as or earlier than existing entries. No restrictions will be applied at the system level.

###

Prevent Unintended Administrator Access Loss During Employee Termination 
Functional Requirements

The solution chosen is Solution 7. When terminating an employee with username “admin”, the system will block the termination process, showing an error message that the username “admin” should be transferred to another employee or remove the employee linked. This error message also shows on termination massive update.

Employee Registration Enhancement

Problem Statement
The current employee registration system mandates username creation even for employees who will never access CATAPA, while also preventing non-OM tenants from assigning cost centers during initial registration. This results in unnecessary data collection, incomplete employee profiles at registration, and additional administrative steps that delay accurate financial reporting.

Objective and Goals
1)        Transform the username field from mandatory to optional in employee registration to accommodate employees who don't require system access

2)        Add cost center field in employee registration form to enable complete financial data capture during initial employee creation

Assumptions
-

Current Implementation
Currently, the employee registration form:

--        Username: Mandatory field for all employees

--        User Email: Optional because not all user will have email address

--        Cost Center: Not available in registration form for OM OFF tenant; must be added through employment data update

--        Implementation spans across web application, massive update functionality, and API endpoints

Competitive Analysis

question: Bagaimana konsep 'Employment Data as Source of Truth' (EDST) mengatasi inefisiensi pada sistem penggajian CATAPA sebelumnya, dan apa hasil survei terkait kesadaran penyewa (tenant) terhadap sinkronisasi data tersebut?
expected_response: Konsep EDST bertujuan menghilangkan duplikasi upaya di mana sebelumnya pengguna harus memperbarui data karyawan di modul personel dan surat keputusan gaji (SK) di modul payroll secara terpisah, yang sering menyebabkan ketidakkonsistenan data. Dengan EDST, pembaruan data karyawan otomatis tercermin dalam perhitungan payroll. Hasil survei menunjukkan bahwa 84,21% penyewa setuju data gaji jabatan diperbarui otomatis. Namun, terdapat masalah kesadaran di mana 66,67% pengguna tidak sadar bahwa mereka perlu memperbarui SK secara manual untuk sinkronisasi data pada sistem lama, dan 50% penyewa baru menyadari ketidaksinkronan tersebut setelah disurvei pada tahun 2024.
expected_chunk_automated:
Employment Data as Source of Truth

Background
Currently, our payroll system requires users to update salary decrees (SK gaji) whenever there are changes in employment data to ensure synchronization. This process involves two separate updates: one for the employment data in the employee modules and another for the salary decree in payroll modules. This duplication of effort often results in inconsistencies and coordination issues, particularly when different teams manage employment and payroll data.

Problem Statement
The current process requires manual updating of both employment data and salary decrees separately, which is inefficient due to double effort and particularly challenging when different teams handle different scopes, requiring additional coordination to ensure data synchronization.

From a system perspective, storing the same data in multiple places is not considered scalable. It leads to a higher potential for errors and increased maintenance efforts. A scalable system relies on a single source of truth to ensure consistency and efficiency.

Objective
To streamline the payroll process by ensuring that employment data updates automatically reflect in payroll calculations and reports, thereby eliminating the need to update data separately. This will reduce errors, save time, and improve data consistency across the system.

In addition, this will be a stepping stone to create a new feature: [Salary by Employee Attribute](https://docs.google.com/document/d/197S3eWej-J3_5qP8LfoKKYp1aHfZ4HH8SwwvuX_dloo/edit#heading=h.pxx3fq71xird). By not storing employment data in the salary decree, the data can be managed independently, allowing for more flexibility.

Solution

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution
CCS Survey

[image_21f753d41b8f307b]

###

Survei menunjukkan 66.67% pengguna tidak sadar perlu memperbarui SK untuk menyinkronkan data karyawan.
Sebanyak 20% pengguna merasa tidak perlu mengupdate SK karena terlalu merepotkan.
6.67% pengguna ingin agar data karyawan berbeda dari data di SK.
Ini adalah pertanyaan kedua dalam survei mengenai pemahaman pengguna tentang pembaruan data karyawan.
Tanggapan menunjukkan perlunya edukasi lebih tentang pentingnya sinkronisasi data karyawan.

[image_21f753d41b8f307b](Caption: Survei menunjukkan 66.67% pengguna tidak sadar perlu memperbarui SK untuk menyinkronkan data karyawan.)

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution

Tenant Survey
By the end of 2023, about 123 tenants had differences between their employment data and salary decrees. We sent out a survey asking if they wanted their salary by job to automatically update with changes in employment data.

19 out of 123 tenants have answered.

1)	84.21% agreed

	a)	37.5% (6 out of 16) of them are sister companies

2)	5.27% no issue

	a)	Because they use editable

	b)	All of them is not sister company

3)	10.52% did not agree

	a)	Turns out all of the users does not use salary by job

	b)	All of them is not sister company

In 2024, we did another survey of tenants who have salary by job, whether they are sister companies or not. The questions were: (a) whether users are aware that any employment data changes are not automatically reflected in salary decree (b) if they are aware why they intentionally make the data different, if they are not aware do they think it is supposed to be automatically updated in payroll.

6 out of 25 tenants have answered.

1)	50% of the tenants said they were not aware that the employment data is not synced.

2)	33.33% said there might be cases when employment data’s changed (promotion) but they don’t want the salary by job’s amount to change (still using the previous amount)

3)	100% agree that employment data should reflect in payroll*

*Such as payroll report but not necessarily automatically change the salary by job amount

Although the tenant participation was not high, based on the survey it shows that the majority agreed to have employment data as reference in payroll (automatically sync without manual update salary decree).

But, we need to be cautious and find any gaps that might be potential issues with the proposed solution–which is option 2 (implement employment data as the source of truth).

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution
Gap Analysis

*Immediate disruption will only happens if we did not create any strategy to overcome the gap between previous condition and proposed solution
Gap Analysis

|    | 0   | 1                                                                                                      | 2                                                                                                                | 3                                                                                                          |
|---:|:----|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|  0 | #   | As Is                                                                                                  | To Be (Use Solution Option 2)                                                                                    | Need to be covered in the To Be?                                                                           |
|  1 | 1   | User need to manually update salary decree every time they want to synchronize employment data         | No need to update SK. Payroll process (report also–refer to payroll process) will refer employment data directly | No                                                                                                         |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                            |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  | Because the to be version brings more benefit for users                                                    |
|  2 | 2   | User can update employment data (promotion or demotion) but the salary by job’s amount does not change | Automatically change salary by job’s amount according to employment data                                         | Yes                                                                                                        |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                            |
|    |     | Users just don’t have to update salary decree                                                          |                                                                                                                  | Because we still need to provide workaround for uses so at least they have workarounds to meet their needs |

This duplication of effort often results in inconsistencies and coordination issues, particularly when different teams manage employment and payroll data.

Problem Statement

From a system perspective, storing the same data in multiple places is not considered scalable. It leads to a higher potential for errors and increased maintenance efforts. A scalable system relies on a single source of truth to ensure consistency and efficiency.

Objective
To streamline the payroll process by ensuring that employment data updates automatically reflect in payroll calculations and reports, thereby eliminating the need to update data separately. This will reduce errors, save time, and improve data consistency across the system.

In addition, this will be a stepping stone to create a new feature: [Salary by Employee Attribute](https://docs.google.com/document/d/197S3eWej-J3_5qP8LfoKKYp1aHfZ4HH8SwwvuX_dloo/edit#heading=h.pxx3fq71xird). By not storing employment data in the salary decree, the data can be managed independently, allowing for more flexibility.

Solution

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution
CCS Survey

[image_21f753d41b8f307b]

###

Survei menunjukkan 66.67% pengguna tidak sadar perlu memperbarui SK untuk menyinkronkan data karyawan.
Sebanyak 20% pengguna merasa tidak perlu mengupdate SK karena terlalu merepotkan.
6.67% pengguna ingin agar data karyawan berbeda dari data di SK.
Ini adalah pertanyaan kedua dalam survei mengenai pemahaman pengguna tentang pembaruan data karyawan.
Tanggapan menunjukkan perlunya edukasi lebih tentang pentingnya sinkronisasi data karyawan.

[image_21f753d41b8f307b](Caption: Survei menunjukkan 66.67% pengguna tidak sadar perlu memperbarui SK untuk menyinkronkan data karyawan.)

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution

Tenant Survey
By the end of 2023, about 123 tenants had differences between their employment data and salary decrees. We sent out a survey asking if they wanted their salary by job to automatically update with changes in employment data.

19 out of 123 tenants have answered.

1)	84.21% agreed

	a)	37.5% (6 out of 16) of them are sister companies

2)	5.27% no issue

	a)	Because they use editable

	b)	All of them is not sister company

3)	10.52% did not agree

	a)	Turns out all of the users does not use salary by job

	b)	All of them is not sister company

In 2024, we did another survey of tenants who have salary by job, whether they are sister companies or not. The questions were: (a) whether users are aware that any employment data changes are not automatically reflected in salary decree (b) if they are aware why they intentionally make the data different, if they are not aware do they think it is supposed to be automatically updated in payroll.

6 out of 25 tenants have answered.

1)	50% of the tenants said they were not aware that the employment data is not synced.

2)	33.33% said there might be cases when employment data’s changed (promotion) but they don’t want the salary by job’s amount to change (still using the previous amount)

3)	100% agree that employment data should reflect in payroll*

*Such as payroll report but not necessarily automatically change the salary by job amount

Although the tenant participation was not high, based on the survey it shows that the majority agreed to have employment data as reference in payroll (automatically sync without manual update salary decree).

But, we need to be cautious and find any gaps that might be potential issues with the proposed solution–which is option 2 (implement employment data as the source of truth).

###

Employment Data as Source of Truth
Solution
Gap Analysis

*Immediate disruption will only happens if we did not create any strategy to overcome the gap between previous condition and proposed solution
Gap Analysis

|    | 0   | 1                                                                                                      | 2                                                                                                                | 3                                                                                                          |
|---:|:----|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|  0 | #   | As Is                                                                                                  | To Be (Use Solution Option 2)                                                                                    | Need to be covered in the To Be?                                                                           |
|  1 | 1   | User need to manually update salary decree every time they want to synchronize employment data         | No need to update SK. Payroll process (report also–refer to payroll process) will refer employment data directly | No                                                                                                         |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                            |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  | Because the to be version brings more benefit for users                                                    |
|  2 | 2   | User can update employment data (promotion or demotion) but the salary by job’s amount does not change | Automatically change salary by job’s amount according to employment data                                         | Yes                                                                                                        |
|    |     |                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                            |
|    |     | Users just don’t have to update salary decree                                                          |                                                                                                                  | Because we still need to provide workaround for uses so at least they have workarounds to meet their needs |

question: Apa saja tiga komponen utama dalam desain sistem sonar smartphone dan bagaimana teknik 'windowing' serta 'pulse compression' membantu meningkatkan akurasi pembacaan?
expected_response: Sistem sonar terdiri dari komponen generasi sinyal, penangkapan sinyal, dan pemrosesan sinyal. 'Pulse compression' menggunakan modulasi frekuensi (linear chirp) untuk memberikan tanda unik pada pulsa sehingga lebih mudah dibedakan dari noise eksternal. Teknik 'windowing' (menggunakan Hanning window) diterapkan dengan mengalikan pulsa dengan fungsi jendela untuk membentuk pulsa tersebut. Hal ini secara signifikan meningkatkan rasio sinyal terhadap noise dengan cara memperbaiki rasio 'peak to side lobe', sehingga puncak tambahan (sidelobes) pada representasi autokorelasi sinyal dapat dihilangkan.
expected_chunk_automated:
A Software Based Sonar Ranging Sensor for Smart Phones
I. INTRODUCTION

Developing new and innovative sensors for smart phones will help open the field to new possibilities and fuel innova- tion. In particular, developing sensors that allow smart phones to perceive depth is key. Google's Advanced Technology and Projects Team share this vision. They are currently working on a smart phone that uses custom hardware to perceive depth. The project is nicknamed: "Project Tango" [4]. Engineers at NASA have also partnered with the Google team to attach these phones to robots that will be sent to the international space station [5]. However, Google's structured light sensor does not perform well in outdoor environments, since the light from the sun interferes with the sensor. In this paper we explore the possibility of using sonar to provide depth sensing capabilities in both indoor and outdoor environments and address two unique research questions: 1) How do we design a sonar sensor for smart phones using only the phone's existing hardware? 2) How do environmental factors such as noise, reverberation and temperature affect the sensor's accuracy ?.

The proposed sonar sensor uses the smart phone's rear speaker and microphone, and implements the sonar capabilities

on a software platform. The software process is comprised of three major steps: 1) a signal generation step, 2) a signal capture step, and 3) a signal processing step. During the signal generation step, the phone's rear speaker emits a pulse. The pulse forms a pressure wave which travels through the air until it encounters an object, which then reflects the pulse and scatters it in multiple directions. During the signal capture step, the microphone captures the reflected pulse, and the distance to the object is determined by calculating the time between the pulse and its reflection.

###

A Software Based Sonar Ranging Sensor for Smart Phones

IV. DESIGN
The system is comprised of three major components: 1) a signal generation component, 2) a signal capture component and 3) a signal processing component. Figure 3 shows an overview of these components. The signal generation com- ponent is responsible for generating the encoded pulse. This component is comprised of two sub-components: a pulse/chirp generation component and a windowing component. The sec- ond component is the signal capture component. The signal capture component records the signal that is reflected from the object. The third component is the signal processing compo- nent. The signal processing component filters the signal and calculates the time between the initial pulse and its reflection. This component is comprised of two sub-components. The first component is the filtering component and the second sub- component is the peak detection component. We discuss each component in detail in the following sections.

A. Generating the Signal
The signal generation process is comprised of two subpro- cesses. The first subprocess generates an encoded pulse, while

Signal Generation

Lin

hanning

Chirp

Window Function

Speaker

Signal Capture

Mircophone

Signal Processing

Cnt

XCORR

Find

Maxima

Idx

Correlation

Peak Finder

###

A Software Based Sonar Ranging Sensor for Smart Phones
A. Generating the Signal

Fig. 3: The figure shows an overview of the sonar system's architecture.

the second subprocess shapes the encoded pulse. We discuss each part of the process in a separate subsection. We begin by discussing the pulse encoding process which is also called pulse compression.

1) Pulse Compression: Pulse compression makes it easier to recover a pulse by encoding the pulse with a unique signature. The pulse can be encoded using amplitude mod- ulation or frequency modulation. Amplitude modulation is the process of encoding a wave by increasing or decreasing the amplitude of sections of the wave, while frequency modulation is the process of varying the frequency of different sections of the wave. The state of the art pulse compression approach uses frequency modulation to create an encoded pulse, since frequency modulation is less susceptible to noise [19]. The encoded pulse is known as a linear chirp. A linear chirp is a signal whose frequency increases linearly from a starting frequency to an ending frequency.

Figure 4a shows an image of the linear chirp in the time and frequency domain. The signal was sampled at 44.1kHz, so each sample index represents 0.227ps. The signal starts at a low frequency and progresses to a higher frequency.

Now that we have discussed the intuition behind a linear chirp, we will look at how the signal is generated. A linear chirp can be expressed as a sinusoidal function. Equation 1 describes how the amplitude of a linear chirp signal varies with time. The value f0 represents the initial frequency while the value k represents chirp rate (how quickly the frequency increases) and ¢. represents the phase of the pulse. The chirp rate can be determined using equation 2.

a(t) = sin 00 +2 ( fox+5 *+2)] (1)

###

A Software Based Sonar Ranging Sensor for Smart Phones
A. Generating the Signal

TABLE I: Chirp properties table

Equation 1 represents the continuous time representation of a linear chirp. However, the signal must be discretized before it can be played by the phone's speaker. The signal is discretized by sampling equation 1 at specific time intervals. The time intervals are determined based on the sample rate and the pulse duration. In our implementation, a linear chirp was generated using the parameters shown in table I. Though

we have selected a linear chirp with these properties it is important to note that other linear chirps can be used with different frequencies and sweep times.

Now that we have discussed how the encoded pulse is generated, we will discuss how the pulse is shaped in the next section. This process of shaping the pulse is known as windowing.

2) Windowing the Pulse: The windowing process is the second subprocess of the signal generating process. The win- dowing subprocess shapes the pulse by passing it through a window. Shaping the pulse improves the pulse's signal to noise ratio by improving the peak to side lobe ratio. This becomes clearer when we compare the autocorrelated representation of the windowed signal in figure 4d with the unwindowed signal in figure 4b. Notice that the autocorrelated representa- tion of the windowed signal does not contain the additional peaks/sidelobes that are in the autocorrelated representation of the unwindowed signal.

###

A Software Based Sonar Ranging Sensor for Smart Phones
A. Generating the Signal

The signal in figure 4c was windowed using a hanning window [20]. The pulse is shaped by multiplying it by a hanning window of the same length. The hanning window is described by equation 3. In equation 3, N represents the number of samples in the window and n represents the index of a sample. Since the pulse is 0.01s and the sample rate is 44.1kHz, the window has a length of 441 samples. The discretized pulse is shaped by performing an element-wise multiplication between the discretized pulse vector and the discretized hanning window. Finally, the discretized shaped pulse is sent to the speaker's buffer to be transmitted.

H[n] = 0.5 * (1 - cos(

2 * T * n N -1 ) (3)

question: Jelaskan arsitektur keamanan, prosedur sinkronisasi data, dan prasyarat platform yang diperlukan untuk mengoperasikan fitur 'Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients'.
expected_response: Fitur ini dikembangkan untuk menyediakan kontrol izin akses yang halus terhadap 20 API kustom berbasis BAPI yang tidak tersedia di API publik standar,. Untuk menjaga integritas data, sistem mengimplementasikan 'Daily Scheduler' yang berjalan setiap hari pukul 00:00 untuk menyinkronkan daftar klien dari platform dan menghapus data usang (stale) di tingkat ekstensi dalam waktu 24 jam,,. Pengguna harus memenuhi prasyarat platform dengan memberikan akses manual pada endpoint 'validate-access-token' dan 'oauth-clients' agar API kustom dapat berfungsi,. Jika prasyarat platform atau izin tingkat ekstensi tidak terpenuhi, sistem secara otomatis akan memberikan respon '403 Forbidden',. Tanpa implementasi kontrol granular ini, seluruh klien berisiko dapat mengakses semua API kustom, yang menimbulkan risiko keamanan tinggi.
expected_chunk_automated:
Djarum - Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

Background
CATAPA Platform currently provides an OAuth 2.0 Clients module used to generate client IDs and client secrets, as well as configure access to CATAPA Public API endpoints.

For Djarum’s integration needs, CATAPA developed 20 custom BAPI-based APIs that are not part of the standard public API set. However, the existing OAuth 2.0 Clients module does not support fine-grained permission configuration for these 20 custom APIs.

To support Djarum and similar enterprise use cases, a new feature—Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients—is required in the CATAPA Extension Platform. This feature allows administrators to manage which custom APIs each client ID is allowed to access.

Additionally, a scheduler is needed to ensure consistency of client ID data between Platform OAuth Clients and extension-level stored permissions.

Problem Statement
Today, the system faces the following issues:

1)	There is no mechanism to configure which of the 20 custom APIs can be accessed by a specific client ID.

2)	Extension-level stored permissions can become stale, because client IDs deleted from the platform are not automatically removed in the extension database.

3)	There is no UI to manage custom API access permissions at the client level.

4)	There is no API-level authorization logic to enforce that only allowed client IDs may call specific custom APIs.

Consequences:

1)	No granular control → all clients can access all custom APIs (security risk).

2)	Data inconsistency between platform and extension.

3)	Admin cannot selectively allow or restrict sensitive custom API operations.

Objective and Goals

###

Djarum - Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

5.2 Data Storage
Extension database stores:

1)	client_id

2)	authorized_endpoints

3)	Timestamps (created_date, updated_date)

5.3 Daily Scheduler
Run every day at 00:00.

Responsibilities:

1)	Fetch client IDs from platform.

2)	Compare with extension DB records.

3)	If a client ID in the extension no longer exists in the platform:

	a)	Delete the record (stale cleanup).

Scheduler is idempotent.

5.4 API Access Validation
For every request made to a Djarum Custom API:

1)	Check required platform permissions

	a)	The client must have access to the mandatory platform OAuth endpoints.

		i)	The client ID must have permission to call: GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token.

	b)	If these prerequisites are missing → the custom API cannot be used, return 403 Forbidden.

2)	Check extension-level custom API permission

	a)	Verify whether the client is allowed to call the specific custom API.

	b)	If not allowed → return 403 Forbidden.

	c)	If allowed → continue processing the request as usual.

5.5 Role & Permission
1)	Introduce a new extension-level trustee:

	a)	Extension OAuth 2.0 Client

		i)	View

		ii)	Manage

2)	Prerequisite for this role:

	a)	User must have Admin Panel – Extension access.

3)	Only authorized users may view or edit this menu.

Functional Requirements

###

Djarum - Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

5.2 Data Storage
Extension database stores:

1)	client_id

2)	authorized_endpoints

3)	Timestamps (created_date, updated_date)

5.3 Daily Scheduler
Run every day at 00:00.

Responsibilities:

1)	Fetch client IDs from platform.

2)	Compare with extension DB records.

3)	If a client ID in the extension no longer exists in the platform:

	a)	Delete the record (stale cleanup).

Scheduler is idempotent.

5.4 API Access Validation
For every request made to a Djarum Custom API:

1)	Check required platform permissions

	a)	The client must have access to the mandatory platform OAuth endpoints.

		i)	The client ID must have permission to call: GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token.

	b)	If these prerequisites are missing → the custom API cannot be used, return 403 Forbidden.

2)	Check extension-level custom API permission

	a)	Verify whether the client is allowed to call the specific custom API.

	b)	If not allowed → return 403 Forbidden.

	c)	If allowed → continue processing the request as usual.

5.5 Role & Permission
1)	Introduce a new extension-level trustee:

	a)	Extension OAuth 2.0 Client

		i)	View

		ii)	Manage

2)	Prerequisite for this role:

	a)	User must have Admin Panel – Extension access.

3)	Only authorized users may view or edit this menu.

Functional Requirements

###

2. Injected Requirements From Product Manager (Use As-Is)

Use the following requirements exactly as stated:

1. **Data storage**

   Data for Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients is stored in the extension database.

2. **Sync logic (stale record cleanup)**

   If a client_id exists in the extension but no longer exists in Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients →

   delete the extension record.

3. **Authentication / Access**

   No additional dependency.

   To call the custom API, the caller only needs:

   - valid client_id

   - client_secret

   - and the client_id must have access to the API

4. **UI Behavior**

   a. “Select All” applies ONLY to the 20 custom APIs

   b. Search operates ONLY within these 20 custom APIs

   c. User must manually grant access to required platform endpoints in Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients:

      - GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token

      - GET /v1/oauth-clients

5. **Custom API List**

   20 APIs below must be configurable per client_id:

   - GET /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_EMP_HISTORY

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_EMP_PER_IT

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_EMP_EDU_FAM

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_MST_EMP

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_MST_OBJ_OM

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_MST_ORG

   - GET /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_MST_PERSONAL

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_MST_STRUCTURE

   - GET /bapi/Z_BPIWRKSCDGETLST

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIAPCUPLOADDATA

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_UPLOAD_ADDPAY

   - GET /bapi/Z_BPIPY_UPLOAD_ADDPAY

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_DOWN_DATA_ADDPAY

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIEMPMEDDETGETLST

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_EMP_PTKP

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_UPL_ESS_EMP_PTKP

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_1721A1

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPYGETWLIST

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_GET_WAGES_FROM_RESULT

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_GET_PENSION_9015

###

2. Injected Requirements From Product Manager (Use As-Is)

- GET /bapi/Z_BPIPY_UPLOAD_ADDPAY

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_DOWN_DATA_ADDPAY

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIEMPMEDDETGETLST

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_ESS_EMP_PTKP

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_UPL_ESS_EMP_PTKP

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPI_DOWN_1721A1

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPYGETWLIST

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_GET_WAGES_FROM_RESULT

   - POST /bapi/Z_BPIPY_GET_PENSION_9015

6. **Prerequisite platform permissions**

   For 20 custom API access to work, Platform OAuth 2.0 Client must be configured with:

   - GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token

   - GET /v1/oauth-clients

7. **New Feature**

   A new menu must be created:

   **Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients**

   - Source client list from Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients

   - Configure custom API access per client_id

8. **Scheduler Requirement**

   A background scheduler must regularly:

   - Retrieve client list from platform OAuth 2.0 Clients

   - Remove orphaned or stale extension records

9. **Role Permissions**

   Add a new trustee for:

   - Menu: Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

   Requirement: User must already have trustee for:

   - Admin Panel → Extension

10. **Repository Target**

   Work is implemented in:

   - FE: CATAPA-EXTENSION/projects/catapa-djarum

   - BE: CATAPA-EXTENSION/projects/catapa-djarum-server

------------------------------------------------------------

###

Feature Specification: Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

Clarifications

Session 2025-11-25

- Q: How frequently should the background scheduler sync with Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients? → A: Once per day at midnight

- Q: How quickly must orphaned records be removed after deletion from the platform? → A: Within 24 hours. The UI always calls the Platform API in real-time to display current client IDs, so the displayed list is always accurate. The daily sync is only for database cleanup.

- Q: What level of audit logging is required for access grants/revocations? → A: No audit logging required for initial phase. This will be added as a future enhancement.

- Q: Should the system implement optimistic locking or conflict detection for concurrent administrator edits? → A: No. Use simple last-save-wins approach. With fewer than 10 clients and minimal likelihood of concurrent edits, locking is unnecessary complexity.

**UI/UX Clarifications:**

- Q: When user loads the Edit Client view, what should the checkboxes display? → A: Show saved state - Load and display currently granted APIs from the extension database

- Q: Should the "Select All" button toggle or always select all? → A: Toggle behavior - If all are checked, it deselects all; if any are unchecked, it selects all

- Q: When clicking Cancel, should there be a confirmation dialog if changes were made? → A: No confirmation - Immediately return to list view and discard all unsaved changes

- Q: What should happen if a user tries to edit a client that was just deleted from Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients? → A: Show error message "Client no longer exists in Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients", then redirect to list view

###

Feature Specification: Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients
Requirements *(mandatory)*
Functional Requirements

Data Storage & Persistence

- **FR-001**: System MUST store Extension OAuth 2.0 Client configurations in the extension database

- **FR-002**: System MUST persist the mapping between client_id and granted custom API access

- **FR-003**: System MUST maintain referential integrity between Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients and Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

Synchronization

- **FR-004**: System MUST implement a background scheduler that regularly retrieves the client list from Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients

- **FR-005**: System MUST delete extension records when the corresponding client_id no longer exists in Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients

- **FR-006**: Scheduler MUST run once per day at midnight to sync with Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients

- **FR-007**: System MUST log sync operation errors for troubleshooting purposes

Authentication & Authorization

- **FR-008**: Custom API calls MUST require a valid client_id and client_secret

- **FR-009**: Custom API calls MUST verify that the client_id has been granted access to the specific API endpoint

- **FR-010**: System MUST verify that the client has platform permissions for GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token

- **FR-011**: System MUST verify that the client has platform permissions for GET /v1/oauth-clients

- **FR-012**: System MUST deny API calls when the client lacks required platform or extension permissions

UI - Menu & Navigation

- **FR-013**: System MUST provide a new menu item "Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients" in the Admin Panel

- **FR-014**: Menu MUST only be visible to users with Extension trustee permissions

- **FR-015**: Menu MUST display a list of all OAuth clients by calling Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients API in real-time (not from extension database)

Djarum - Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

5.2 Data Storage
Extension database stores:

1)	client_id

2)	authorized_endpoints

3)	Timestamps (created_date, updated_date)

5.3 Daily Scheduler
Run every day at 00:00.

Responsibilities:

1)	Fetch client IDs from platform.

2)	Compare with extension DB records.

3)	If a client ID in the extension no longer exists in the platform:

	a)	Delete the record (stale cleanup).

Scheduler is idempotent.

5.4 API Access Validation
For every request made to a Djarum Custom API:

1)	Check required platform permissions

	a)	The client must have access to the mandatory platform OAuth endpoints.

		i)	The client ID must have permission to call: GET /v1/oauth-clients/validate-access-token.

	b)	If these prerequisites are missing → the custom API cannot be used, return 403 Forbidden.

2)	Check extension-level custom API permission

	a)	Verify whether the client is allowed to call the specific custom API.

	b)	If not allowed → return 403 Forbidden.

	c)	If allowed → continue processing the request as usual.

5.5 Role & Permission
1)	Introduce a new extension-level trustee:

	a)	Extension OAuth 2.0 Client

		i)	View

		ii)	Manage

2)	Prerequisite for this role:

	a)	User must have Admin Panel – Extension access.

3)	Only authorized users may view or edit this menu.

###

Feature Specification: Extension OAuth 2.0 Clients

Clarifications

Session 2025-11-25

- Q: How frequently should the background scheduler sync with Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients? → A: Once per day at midnight

- Q: How quickly must orphaned records be removed after deletion from the platform? → A: Within 24 hours. The UI always calls the Platform API in real-time to display current client IDs, so the displayed list is always accurate. The daily sync is only for database cleanup.

- Q: What level of audit logging is required for access grants/revocations? → A: No audit logging required for initial phase. This will be added as a future enhancement.

- Q: Should the system implement optimistic locking or conflict detection for concurrent administrator edits? → A: No. Use simple last-save-wins approach. With fewer than 10 clients and minimal likelihood of concurrent edits, locking is unnecessary complexity.

**UI/UX Clarifications:**

- Q: When user loads the Edit Client view, what should the checkboxes display? → A: Show saved state - Load and display currently granted APIs from the extension database

- Q: Should the "Select All" button toggle or always select all? → A: Toggle behavior - If all are checked, it deselects all; if any are unchecked, it selects all

- Q: When clicking Cancel, should there be a confirmation dialog if changes were made? → A: No confirmation - Immediately return to list view and discard all unsaved changes

- Q: What should happen if a user tries to edit a client that was just deleted from Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients? → A: Show error message "Client no longer exists in Platform OAuth 2.0 Clients", then redirect to list view

question: Apa langkah teknis yang harus dilakukan di sistem CATAPA jika pengiriman Bulk Multi Payroll ke BCA dinyatakan gagal, dan apa saja contoh kode error yang mungkin muncul?
expected_response: Jika status transaksi Bulk Multi Payroll di KlikBCA Bisnis dinyatakan 'Failed' (gagal), pengguna harus melakukan 'Undo' data yang gagal pada menu Salary Disbursement dan kemudian melakukan 'Undo' pada data yang sama di menu Salary Process > Salary Payment. Setelah itu, proses pembayaran harus diulang kembali. Contoh kode error yang mungkin muncul antara lain: '101' (Field wajib kosong), '104' (Tanggal efektif tidak valid), '115' (Kode perusahaan salah), '131' (ID Transaksi tidak unik), dan '151' (Nominal melebihi limit).

question: Mengapa metode PSO-BPNN dianggap lebih unggul daripada model log-distance tradisional dalam menentukan jarak pada sistem navigasi indoor?
expected_response: PSO-BPNN lebih unggul karena model log-distance tradisional sulit memetakan hubungan RSSI dan jarak yang akurat di lingkungan dalam ruangan yang kompleks. PSO digunakan untuk mengoptimalkan parameter (bobot dan ambang batas) pada neural network agar tidak terjebak dalam solusi lokal optimal dan mempercepat konvergensi. Hasil eksperimen menunjukkan PSO-BPNN memiliki tingkat error terendah (0.25) dibandingkan BPNN standar atau model logaritmik, sehingga menghasilkan akurasi posisi yang jauh lebih stabil.
expected_chunk_automated:
Figure 4. The positioning schematic diagram.

4.2. PSO-BPNN RSSI Distance Model
It is difficult to accurately map the relationship between RSSI and distance with the logarithmic distance loss model. In this section, the PSO-BPNN Algorithm 1 is used to train the RSSI distance model. The PSO-BPNN is composed of a three-layer structure, including one input node, i hidden nodes, and one output node. The training sample input value is RSSI = { RSSI1, . . . , RSSIj, . .. , RSSIn}. The training sample output value is D = {d1, . . . , dj, . . . , dn}. As shown in Figure 5, wi is defined as the weights from the input layer to the hidden layer, 0¡ is defined as the threshold value of the hidden layer node, @j is defined as the weights from the hidden layer to the output layer, y is defined as the threshold value of the output layer node, and O is defined as the output of the neural network.

###

4.2. PSO-BPNN RSSI Distance Model

Figure 5. Neural network structure.

The PSO preliminarily optimizes the parameters of BPNN to avoid the BPNN falling into the local optimal solution. In the PSO algorithm, the potential solution of each optimization problem is imagined as a point in a x-dimensional space which is called a particle. The particle moves around in the search space according to simple mathematical formulae regarding the particle's position and velocity. Each particle's movement is also influenced by its local best known position and the global best known position, which are found by the fitness function. After many iterations, the optimal positions of the particles and the extremum of the fitness function are calculated. In this paper, the fitness function is shown as

i=1 n

Fit = >di - 0i. (11)

The PSO iteration formula is

%+1 = uva+arı (Pia - xa) + c2r2 (Pg,d - cia) x+1 =xi,a+vặt1, (12)

where xid = {w),.W.,O .... ..... ], ...... .. 4} are the particles. u means the inertia weight, r1 and r2 are two random numbers in the range [0, 1]. c1 and c2 are two positive constants which is called learning factor or accelerating factor. C1 is used to adjusted the step length of the particle flying to its own best position. c2 is used to adjusted the step length of the particle flying to the swarm's best position. Pi,d is the optimal value searched by the i-th particle. Pg,d is the optimal value searched by the whole particle swarm.

Neural network weights and thresholds can be optimized through multiple iterations. The optimized weights and thresholds are assigned to the BPNN to further train the network model. The hidden layer output is (13)

The output layer output is (14)

###

5. Experiment

Figure 8. The standard deviation of the RSSI before and after correction.

In this paper, three methods were tested to fit the RSSI distance model, including the logarithmic distance loss model, BPNN, and PSO-BPNN. In the test, BPNN and PSO-BPNN adopted a single hidden layer network with five hidden layer nodes. The results of the tests are given in Figure 9. Figure 10 shows the normalized sum of squared errors (SSE) of the RSSI distance model fitted by three methods . The SSE of the logarithmic distance model fitting with the least squares algorithm was 0.29. The SSE of the RSSI distance model trained by the BP neural network was 0.30. The RSSI distance model trained by PSO-BPNN had the lowest error rate-the error rate was only 0.25-and it showed good robustness.

5. Experiment

Figure 9. The result of RSSI distance model fitted by the logarithmic distance loss model, back propagation neural network (BPNN), and back propagation neural network optimized by particle swarm optimization (PSO-BPNN).

The results of the indoor positioning experiment are shown in Figure 11. Since the noise caused by the RSSI fluctuation cannot be eliminated, the traditional Kalman filtering method has great positioning error. By employing the Bluetooth gateway to correct RSSI in real-time, and further using PSO-BPNN to train the RSSI distance model, better positioning results were achieved. In 30 consecutive positioning tests, our method showed more stable positioning.

###

5. Experiment

Figure 11. Comparison of the positioning results between the traditional and proposed methods.

We randomly selected eight test points in the office, and their positioning errors are shown in Figure 12. We can see that due to the fluctuation of the Bluetooth system, the positioning results were still poor even when the Kalman Filter was used. The root mean square error (RMSE) was 2.0361 m, the mean absolute error (MAE) was 1.8357 m, and the maximum positioning error was 3.29 m. The Kalman filter and PSO-BPNN RSSI distance model were able to effectively reduce the positioning error- the RMSE was 1.1279 m, the MAE was 0.9704 m, and the maximum positioning error was 2.21 m.

The method proposed in ref. [27] was able to reduce the error caused by the RSSI fluctuation, but it brings new error due to the approximate nature of the calculation. The RMSE was 0.9583 m, the MAE was 0.7882 m, and the maximum positioning error was 3.23 m. After correcting the RSSI and accurately estimating the RSSI distance model by the proposed method, the positioning accuracy improved obviously. The RMSE was only 0.7343 m, the MAE was 0.7018 m, and the maximum positioning error was only 1.61 m. The results show that the noise caused by the RSSI fluctuation was reduced and our algorithm provided a good positioning result.

###

6. Conclusions and Future Work
This paper presents an indoor location method for the dynamic correction of RSSI by deploying the Bluetooth gateway. The location of the Bluetooth gateway is not strictly required; it is only required that each anchor node can communicate with at least one Bluetooth gateway. In addition, we used the PSO-BPNN trained RSSI-distance model in the offline stage. Then, we used the proposed algorithm to correct the RSSI in real-time and used the Kalman filter to further smooth the data. After smoothing the RSSI, the distance between the blind node and the BLE node was estimated by the PSO-BPNN RSSI distance model. Finally we used the least squares algorithm to estimate the terminal position. The experimental results show that the algorithm can improve the positioning accuracy and meet the requirements of the indoor positioning system. In this paper, some special positions were not considered, like indoor corners and other complex electromagnetic regions. Moreover, it is difficult to obtain continuous positioning with high precision only by BLE positioning technology. Therefore, the proposed method can be further improved by fusion positioning with multiple sensors which could be investigated in the future, including the positioning in some special cases.

4.2. PSO-BPNN RSSI Distance Model
It is difficult to accurately map the relationship between RSSI and distance with the logarithmic distance loss model. In this section, the PSO-BPNN Algorithm 1 is used to train the RSSI distance model. The PSO-BPNN is composed of a three-layer structure, including one input node, i hidden nodes, and one output node. The training sample input value is RSSI = { RSSI1, . . . , RSSIj, . .. , RSSIn}. The training sample output value is D = {d1, . . . , dj, . . . , dn}. As shown in Figure 5, wi is defined as the weights from the input layer to the hidden layer, 0¡ is defined as the threshold value of the hidden layer node, @j is defined as the weights from the hidden layer to the output layer, y is defined as the threshold value of the output layer node, and O is defined as the output of the neural network.

question: Jelaskan empat kategori 'Proximity State' pada iBeacon berdasarkan jaraknya serta faktor apa saja yang mempengaruhi akurasi pengukurannya?
expected_response: iBeacon memiliki empat status kedekatan: 'Immediate' (0-1 meter, sangat andal), 'Near' (1-3 meter, jarak terpercaya), 'Far' (lebih dari 3 meter, kurang akurat), dan 'Unknown' jika sinyal tidak diterima. Pengukuran jarak pada titik referensi 1m hingga 5m menunjukkan adanya error antara 0.34m hingga 2.79m. Akurasi ini dipengaruhi oleh berbagai faktor seperti masa pakai baterai, konfigurasi ruang, pergerakan manusia, serta lokasi dan orientasi smartphone itu sendiri.
expected_chunk_automated:
Method for Improving Indoor Positioning Accuracy Using Extended Kalman Filter
2. Related Work

iBeacon periodically broadcasts only a few signals, including the universally unique identifier (UUID), major value, minor value, and transmissions (TX) power, to identify the beacon and calculate the distance, as shown in Figure 2. Thus, all indoor LBS are processed on smartphones and service servers.

In the case of the Estimote Beacon (Estimote Beacons are small wireless sensors based on BLE; they broadcast tiny radio signals that can be received and interpreted by smartphones, thereby facilitating microlocation and con- textual awareness; Estimote Beacons are tiny computers, each having a powerful Advanced RISC Machine (ARM) processor, memory, and bluetooth smart module; Estimote Beacons are certified to be compatible with iBeacon), which supports iBeacon, the signal transmission cycle and output can be easily modified using a specialized tool. Changing the signal transmission cycle and output will alter the dis- tance measured between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone [16]. However, modifying the signal output does not guarantee improved accuracy of the measured distance. Therefore, the measurement derived from the iBeacon signal has to be interpreted differently depending on the distance, as summarized in Table 1 [15].

Nevertheless, the definitions stated in Table 1 do not mean that the distance cannot be directly measured using iBeacon. In fact, it means that, in the case of distances estimated using

Preamble (1 byte)

Access address (4 bytes)

PDU (2-39 bytes)

CRC (3 bytes)

Advertising channel PDU

Header (2 bytes)

MAC address (6 bytes)

Data (0-31 bytes)

iBeacon data packet format

iBeacon prefix (9 bytes)

Proximity UDDI (16 bytes)

Major (2 bytes)

Minor (2 bytes)

TX power (1 byte)

###

Method for Improving Indoor Positioning Accuracy Using Extended Kalman Filter
2. Related Work

TX power (1 byte)
FIGURE 2: iBeacon packet format.
TABLE 1: Four proximity states of iBeacon.
Glossary

|    | 0                                                                                                                                 | 1                                                                                                                     |
|---:|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|  0 | Glossary                                                                                                                          | Description                                                                                                           |
|  1 | Accuracy                                                                                                                          | A distance value in terms of meters                                                                                   |
|  2 | Proximity state (estimates of the distance between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone that appears in the CLBeacon class) | (i) Immediate: distance between 0 and 1 m; high reliability. (ii) Near: distance between 1 and 3 m; trusted distance. |
|  3 | Proximity state (estimates of the distance between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone that appears in the CLBeacon class) | (iii) Far: distance greater than 3 m. The measured distance is not the actual distance to the iBeacon                 |
|  4 | Proximity state (estimates of the distance between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone that appears in the CLBeacon class) | transmitter.                                                                                                          |
|  5 | Proximity state (estimates of the distance between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone that appears in the CLBeacon class) | (iv) Unknown: iBeacon signal is not received.                                                                         |
|  6 | Proximity state (estimates of the distance between the iBeacon transmitter and the smartphone that appears in the CLBeacon class) | Measurement reference value: the RSSI values (-59 dBm) received at a distance of 1 m.                                 |

###

Method for Improving Indoor Positioning Accuracy Using Extended Kalman Filter
4. Analysis

FIGURE 9: Signal property at 1 m.

where PL is total path loss, PTx/PRx are transmitted and received signal strength, respectively, d is measured distance, do is standard distance (define: 1 m), X g is standard deviation (define: 0), and n is path loss exponent.

After substituting PRx(do) with -59 dBm, the signal strength for the 1 m reference point described in the iBeacon development document, (1), (2), (3), and (4) were used to calculate the relative distance measurement per RSSI signal strength.

Figure 9 shows measurements of the distance to the iBeacon transmitter from a distance of 1 m. The average of the six measurements to the iBeacon transmitter was 0.6 m, which had an error of 0.34 m. Figure 10 shows measurements of the distance to the iBeacon transmitter from a distance of 3 m. The average of the six measurements to the iBeacon transmitter was 1.39 m, which had an error of 1.61 m. Fig- ure 11 shows measurements of the distance to the iBeacon transmitter from a distance of 5 m. The average of the six measurements to the iBeacon transmitter was 2.21 m, which had an error of 2.79 m.

Thus, the distance measurements from the 1m, 3 m, and 5 m points resulted in errors of 0.34-2.79 m from the real distance. Based on this result, it can be confirmed that

while it is possible to measure the distance using only the iBeacon's RSSI value, an error would exist between the real and calculated distances. This is due to a number of factors that cause changes in the received RSSI value, such as the battery life, experiment environment, space configuration, human movement, and smartphone location and direction.

###

Method for Improving Indoor Positioning Accuracy Using Extended Kalman Filter
4. Analysis

while it is possible to measure the distance using only the iBeacon's RSSI value, an error would exist between the real and calculated distances. This is due to a number of factors that cause changes in the received RSSI value, such as the battery life, experiment environment, space configuration, human movement, and smartphone location and direction.

Figure 12 shows the average measurement per unit distance. The average was calculated using the distance measured on the basis of the RSSI value determined from distances of 1m, 2m, 3m, 5m, and 10 m. Figure 13 shows the standard deviation of the measurements per distance. The distance was measured using 1 m, 2 m, 3 m, 5 m, and 10 m as reference points to verify the accuracy of the "immediate," "near," and "far" distances defined in the iBeacon devel- opment document. As can be seen, the deviation was not high when the measurement was taken from distances of 1 m and 2 m, but it increased for distances of 3 m and 5 m and increased further for 10 m.

4.2. Indoor Positioning Using Extended Kalman Filter. From the analysis of the iBeacon's signal property (Section 4.1), we confirmed that there were irregularities and variations in the measurements of the iBeacon RSSI according to the distance and the beacon. Because a single distance measurement using the iBeacon RSSI is not reliable, it is necessary to create a measurement noise model for application to an extended Kalman filter based on the result of the signal property analysis. Figure 12 shows the average measurement per unit distance. The average was calculated using the distance measured on the basis of the RSSI value determined from distances of 1m, 2m, 3m, 5m, and 10 m. Figure 13 shows the standard deviation of the measurements per distance. The distance was measured using 1 m, 2 m, 3 m, 5 m, and 10 m as reference points to verify the accuracy of the "immediate," "near," and "far" distances defined in the iBeacon devel- opment document. As can be seen, the deviation was not high when the measurement was taken from distances of 1 m and 2 m, but it increased for distances of 3 m and 5 m and increased further for 10 m.

4.2. Indoor Positioning Using Extended Kalman Filter. From the analysis of the iBeacon's signal property (Section 4.1), we confirmed that there were irregularities and variations in the measurements of the iBeacon RSSI according to the distance and the beacon. Because a single distance measurement using the iBeacon RSSI is not reliable, it is necessary to create a measurement noise model for application to an extended Kalman filter based on the result of the signal property analysis. Table 3 lists the inclination per section of the standard deviation shown in Figure 13.

As can be seen in Table 3, BS6 is not a reliable measure- ment because of the irregular change in the deviation per

question: Jelaskan alur penanganan pembayaran akhir (Final Payment) bagi karyawan yang berhenti bekerja di UW dan kondisi teknologi apa yang membuat sistem menghasilkan pembayaran tersebut secara otomatis?
expected_response: Alur dimulai ketika Departemen/HR menerima notifikasi pemisahan karyawan (termasuk karena pensiun atau kematian) melalui teknologi. Payroll kemudian menginisiasi perhitungan pembayaran akhir yang mencakup sisa cuti (vacation), kompensasi waktu, dan penyesuaian kelebihan pembayaran (overpayments). Secara teknologi, sistem diintegrasikan dengan modul waktu dan kehadiran (T&A) untuk mendapatkan data pembayaran PTO akhir. Syarat agar pembayaran akhir (final payment) dapat dihasilkan secara otomatis oleh sistem adalah jika nilai pembayaran (payout) yang dihitung lebih besar daripada nilai kelebihan pembayaran (overpayment) yang ada. Setelah itu, cek dapat diberikan langsung ke karyawan atau diterima melalui siklus payroll reguler, dan status karyawan diubah menjadi 'Separated'.

question: Apa saja batasan teknis (kapasitas dan jumlah file) dalam fitur unggah massal Repositori CATAPA, bagaimana aturan penamaan filenya, serta kategori apa saja yang tersedia untuk dipilih oleh pengguna?
expected_response: Dalam fitur unggah massal repositori, terdapat batasan maksimal ukuran file ZIP sebesar 500 MB dan jumlah file maksimal 1.000 file per satu kali unggah; kedua kondisi ini harus terpenuhi agar proses dapat dilanjutkan. Aturan penamaan file mencakup panjang maksimal 255 karakter, menggunakan karakter A-Z, a-z, 0-9, serta simbol underscore (_), hyphen (-), dan period (.). Kategori file yang dapat dipilih pengguna (Opsi 5) meliputi: Warnings and Disciplinary, Transfer and Movements, Salary Related, Employment Contracts, dan Others. Data dari fitur lain seperti Personal Data, Education, dan Identity Card akan masuk ke kategori "Linked Data" secara otomatis.
expected_chunk_automated:
Repository Enhancement
Solution Phase 1: Show in ESS and Massive Upload

D)	Repository Massive Upload
2)	Enable HR administrators to upload file simultaneously for multiple employees using a template-based approach (Excel + ZIP file), following the proven pattern from Sunfish, LinovHR, and Talenta.

3)	Core Principle: Validated before commit (prevent errors), and processed in the background (non-blocking).

4)	Rules:

	a)	Maximum number of files per upload:

		i)	Rules

Maximum per bulk upload:

- Total ZIP size: 500 MB maximum

- File count: 1,000 files maximum

- Must satisfy BOTH conditions

		ii)	Logic

Upload allowed if:

  (ZIP size ≤ 500 MB) AND (File count ≤ 1,000)

	b)	File Name Rules:

		i)	Maximum Length: 255 characters

		ii)	Allowed Characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, underscore (_), hyphen (-), period (.)

		iii)	Disallowed: All special characters except underscore, hyphen, period

		iv)	Spaces: Allowed but discouraged (may cause issues in exports)

5)	Template columns:

Solution Phase 1: Show in ESS and Massive Upload
D)	Repository Massive Upload

ii)	Allowed Characters: A-Z, a-z, 0-9, underscore (_), hyphen (-), period (.)
		iii)	Disallowed: All special characters except underscore, hyphen, period
		iv)	Spaces: Allowed but discouraged (may cause issues in exports)
5)	Template columns:

|  6 | Display on ESS   | ✅ Yes   | True or false                          | Yes                       |

Repository Enhancement
Solution Phase 1: Show in ESS and Massive Upload
B)	Repository Category

		i)	Warnings and Disciplinary

5)	Migration Strategy

	a)	Migrate all existing repositories that were not created from linked features into the category “Others”.

question: Jelaskan prosedur simulasi Take Home Pay (THP), fitur utama, serta standar keamanan data yang diterapkan pada fitur CATAPA Analytics Assistant GPT.
expected_response: Untuk melakukan simulasi THP pada Analytics Assistant GPT, pengguna harus memasukkan nominal THP yang diinginkan dalam Rupiah (IDR), yang merupakan penghasilan bersih yang akan diterima karyawan. Bagian lain seperti tunjangan tidak tetap dan bonus bersifat opsional, namun data yang lebih lengkap akan menghasilkan simulasi yang lebih akurat. Pengguna juga dapat menyesuaikan detail konfigurasi Pajak dan BPJS melalui antarmuka yang intuitif. Fitur utama asisten analitik ini meliputi pemrosesan bahasa alami (NLP) untuk mengekstrak informasi, visualisasi data (bagan dan grafik), serta laporan yang dapat diunduh dalam format .xlsx. Dari sisi keamanan dan privasi, data pengguna diproses secara aman tanpa retensi di luar sesi dan jawaban dienkripsi. Informasi PII (Personally Identifiable Information) akan dianonimkan, dan perintah (prompt) pengguna tidak digunakan untuk melatih model GPT. Selain itu, akses terhadap fitur ini dibatasi secara ketat oleh sistem menu trustee dan data trustee guna menjamin perlindungan data standar. Alur pengguna dimulai dari login ke dashboard HRIS, memasukkan kueri, dan diakhiri dengan peninjauan hasil visualisasi oleh pengguna.
